awd_titl_txt: Flow and Mass Transport in Electrochemical Systems with     Shape Change
awd_abstract_narration: This research project is concerned with modeling the flow and transport         in electrochemical systems with significant shape change effects.               Typical examples are electrochemical deposition and etching processes.          While the diffusion dominated limit will be studied, the main focus is          on systems with significant convective transport effects.  The research         utilizes a Galerkin finite element method coupled with an adaptive mesh         technique implemented on a Class VI computer to solve the appropriate           continuum models.  The development of such techniques coupled with              numerical experiments will allow the technical community to gain new            insights into the fundamentals of such processes, as well as provide            for the possibility of predicting "operating windows" and forecasting           scale-up problems in the commercialization of such processes.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO
